citations.narrative:
Two arctic foxes do not have access to an appropriate climatic shelter to prevent discomfort. One of the foxes had a
hunched posture and shivered continuously. A video taken during the inspection shows the fox shivering for at least 22
seconds, which is abnormal. The only shelter the fox has access to is a domed plastic shelter that has no bedding and the
flooring of the enclosure is composed of river rock. While the roof of the enclosure is a solid surface, the sides are
constructed of coated-wire fencing that has no wind breaks. The inspector’s kestrel displayed a temperature of 21.5
degrees Fahrenheit with a wind chill of 19.4 degrees Fahrenheit immediately adjacent to the enclosure. The Weather
Channel predicts an overnight low of 2 degrees Fahrenheit with winds at 25-35 miles per hour for December 4-5, 2024.
Inadequate shelters do not afford animals protection from wind, rain, snow or other weather extremes. Cold weather
exposure can lead to hypothermia and/or unnecessary stress and discomfort. The licensee must ensure that all animals
have access to appropriate shelter for the local climatic conditions and that shelters provide adequate protection to
prevent discomfort. The licensee added bedding at the time of inspection.
Correct by: 0800 hours on December 05, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.127(b)  Direct
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
Two arctic foxes do not have access to an appropriate climatic shelter to prevent discomfort. One of the foxes had a 
hunched posture and shivered continuously. A video taken during the inspection shows the fox shivering for at least 22 
seconds, which is abnormal. The only shelter the fox has access to is a domed plastic shelter that has no bedding and the 
flooring of the enclosure is composed of river rock. While the roof of the enclosure is a solid surface, the sides are 
constructed of coated-wire fencing that has no wind breaks. The inspector’s kestrel displayed a temperature of 21.5 
degrees Fahrenheit with a wind chill of 19.4 degrees Fahrenheit immediately adjacent to the enclosure. The Weather 
Channel predicts an overnight low of 2 degrees Fahrenheit with winds at 25-35 miles per hour for December 4-5, 2024. 
 
Inadequate shelters do not afford animals protection from wind, rain, snow or other weather extremes. Cold weather 
exposure can lead to hypothermia and/or unnecessary stress and discomfort. The licensee must ensure that all animals 
have access to appropriate shelter for the local climatic conditions and that shelters provide adequate protection to 
prevent discomfort. The licensee added bedding at the time of inspection.  
 
Correct by: 0800 hours on December 05, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
